comments.commentBody:
The normalization of lies and spin - it seems so very comfortable for them - has been perfected by this administration:

Sarah Isgur Flores, Mr. Sessions’s spokeswoman, said “there was absolutely nothing misleading about his answer” because he did not communicate with the ambassador in his capacity as a Trump campaign surrogate.

As he was leaning toward Medvedev in Seoul, Obama was overheard asking for time — “particularly with missile defense” — until he is in a better position politically to resolve such issues.

“I understand your message about space,” replied Medvedev, who will hand over the presidency to Putin in May.

“This is my last election … After my election I have more flexibility,” Obama said, expressing confidence that he would win a second term.

“I will transmit this information to Vladimir,” said Medvedev, Putin’s protégé and long considered number two in Moscow’s power structure.

The exchange, parts of it inaudible, was monitored by a White House pool of television journalists as well as Russian reporters listening live from their press center.
Does anyone think for one second that if Hillary had won the election, there would have been any ink wasted writing about the Russians? What a joke.

replies.commentBody: CWW, Obama was president when he said that. Trump had not been inaugurated yet when Flynn spoke with the Russian ambassador. We have only one president at a time. There were two and a half months between the election and inauguration, maybe Trump did not realize he didn't become president as soon as the election was over.

How did any of this undermine US elections? Answer, not at all!
The Russians compromised Trump and interfered in our election for president. That is the story. Please stop deflecting.

comments.commentBody:
"I'll have more flexibility after the election" - Barack Hussein Obama
That's evidence in Obama's relationship with Russia...isn't it? He met them face to face when he said that. He and Hillary gave them America's uranium that they in turn gave to Iran. Obama and Kerry also gave Iran Billions of Dollars to fund their nuclear ambitions. The Obama regime sided with Russia and it's allies against the west. But, "Trump"...that makes so much more sense, eh.
Where there's smoke...you know the rest.
I think guys, it is time to remind you that Obama is not your president anymore.

It seems pretty obvious why Sessions wanted to head up the Russia-Trump investigation. Sessions needs to recuse himself. Either he lied during the senate confirmations or he has an advanced case of dementia and cannot remember conversations with a Russian ambassador/spy. Both are grounds for his removal.

Months and years of investigations of Monica Lewinsky, Travelgate, Benghazi, and Clinton emails is the GOP's man-made distraction, while they've sold off American democracy to the oligarchs, Russians or anyone who can line their pockets. The Republican party no longer represents America and the American people.

This morning I went and had a bagel with some cream cheese and lox, from local mosad agent, then had coffee at a place where the cartel sells coffee, followed by picking up my dry cleaning from North Korean agents. I think we have so many innuendo's, so many "if's" and usual group of unnamed sources and a large pool of soon to be unemployed previous administration appointments(if not already) desperate for an answer on how they got to where they are.  I am surprised that the tolerance police does not speak out about stereotyping every Russian as some agent or operative.... Ready to overthrow the government and world order? Still no one has anything concrete other than typical everyday business world interactions. Still waiting for evidence. . .

replies.commentBody:
You're wrong. Obama went to McConnell during the beginning of these revelations and asked for both parties to make a bipartisan statement together condemning Russian influence in the election campaigning and election in general and McConnell said that would come off as partisan.

Obama was trapped in to given the impression that any real public disclosures of this whole matter would be him picking sides.

While I agree with you one can see his position of not wanting to give the GOP a plausible reason to accuse the DEMs of interference meant to alter the election.
As you well know the GOP has no such compunctions about lying or interfering in the correct process of our system to alter it for their own ends. It is starting to look like they will even go as far as using Russian help to do so.

momalle3, Obama was between a rock and a hard place.  He did release some information back in Oct 2016 but keep in mind, Sen McConnell threaten Obama that any release to the public would appear partisan.  Unlike Comey, Obama didn't want to appear tipping the election in favor of anyone.  So I think this is why Obama had limited to how much he was releasing to the public (well aside from protecting our spies).

comments.commentBody: This whole thing is bizarre. Why can't this be made public? Why was it hidden like a breadcrumb trail? Who benefits from that? Far from being a hero, I think Obama grossly mismanaged the whole business.

Can't wait for the 1st-98th Time, Politicians on the Hill start saying things like (by mistake mind you),

"I heed my remaining time to the Russian Senator from Montana."

When the Washington Post last night broke the story about Sessions having undisclosed contacts with the Russian ambassador, the New York Times should have immediately swapped in that story for this one, instead of making the Sessions story a mere adjunct to their original article. The Sessions problem is clearly the one that needs immediate attention. It's a - pardon the word - huge issue.

By continuing to emphasize their original story, which certainly is of interest, they are doing a disservice to their readers. The New York Times is supposed to be a newspaper, not a history journal. The WaPo definitely scooped them on this, but the NY Times, in response, needs to follow up vigorously on the story, rather than, out of some sort of competitive pique, ignore it. It's been 12 hours already.

replies.commentBody: They can be subpoenaed to testify, which I'm certain you don't want.

comments.commentBody: This is rich.  Obama staff (who have absolutely positively no political interests in this story, completely neutral and objective bunch!), unnamed sources (!!) who cannot talk because they are leaking 'classified' information (oops).  Where are the famous NYT fact checkers?  This is garbage.
Obama never would have even bothered with sanctions against Russian if Clinton had won.  He is just upset because Trump's victory is a clear repudiation of his legacy.

replies.commentBody: There's a reason America has rejected the democrats since 2010. It isn't because they're "smart" or want America to be prosperous, productive and a free country.  Dems are losers, and becoming violent, despondent and too depressed for anyone to tolerate

comments.commentBody:
Even though it was decades ago, I have such a clear recollection of that day that Nixon resigned. Watching it happen in real time.

Either Jeff Sessions lied. Or his memory is failing. In either case, he must resign.

The "resident" has always surrounded himself with shady characters - like himself. We have a bunch of liars and evil-doers, undermining our national security and our Republic - sitting in the White House. (Yikes!)

The sooner the bunch of them - every last one - is banished from the corridors of power, the safer I will feel. For you. And for me.

How long must this go on?

replies.commentBody: Great argument with the only exception being that the first sentence, you know the basis of the argument, is fiction.

"..in 2012".
You mean, when he was the President of the United States already? When he had the right, legally, to speak with any international leader?
That is, if your reference is even accurate.

comments.commentBody:
Let's see, when a member of Trump's team suggests to a Russian representative that they will be more able to respond to sanctions if elected, it is a serious breach of something. However, when Obama states to Medvedev, the Russian President that he will be more able to deal with Russia on missile defense in Europe after the 2012 election it was not.

If there is an investigation of Russian interference in the US election it should include all interference by all countries including the US in each other's elections. Relative to the Russians, this would include Bill Clinton's funding supporting the election of Yeltsin, who really leaked Hillary's emails to WikiLeaks, Obama's and Hillary's teams meetings with foreign governments who openly spoke out supporting Hillary's candidacy, all FBI wire taps of all personnel working all 2016 election campaign candidates including who authorized the wire taps, all contacts by members of Congress, not just contacts by Trump's team.

Otherwise, this is just another witch hunt being blown out of proportion by the media reporting fake news.

replies.commentBody: Why do you say "good for Obama?"  He should have caught the hacking earlier and spoken up earlier. Leaving breadcrumbs is a pitiful legacy. I'm disappointed in him.

comments.commentBody: Good for Obama.  Hillary underestimated trump and underestimated the hatred of many men and women for a woman running for office.  Had Hiliary chosen a black or hispanic running mate, she'd be president.  I've said this for years, you have to get out the black and hispanic vote.  She did not do so.

Right now about the only city that has more Russian influence in it than Washington DC is Moscow.

Subject to change of course.

Press 1 for English, Press 2 for Spanish, Press 3 for Russian, and Press 0 if you need to talk to the Kremlin Directly.

TRUMP - release your tax returns NOW!

CONGRESS - investigate all of this, in public NOW! Not behind closed doors.
Do it the same for Trump as you felt so compelled to do with Hillary.
Thank you President Obama and intelligence officials for preserving this information.  Your prescience and patriotism may save our Republic.
Donald Trump was right! The election was rigged because he rigged it.

Another NYT's non story story.  The Russians did not hack the election, neither Putin nor any other Russian representative made me vote for Trump.  The Democrats lost because they backed a losing candidate whose platform was out of touch with the voters.  If the Chair of the DNC took cyber security in such a lax manner as to use 'password" as his password then one should not be too surprised to see their emails leaked.

Wow, them Russians are so ingrained, so quickly at the top of our Food Chain (as it pertains to Politix),....

We don't even get a chance to chant.

"The Ruskies are coming, The Ruskies are coming,.."

Instead we're stuck with,

"The Ruskies are already here and they're apparently renting to own!"
If lying to Congress is not met by a complete civil and governmental uprising, then ANYONE can lie to Congress and get away with it.  THROW Sessions out on his heels and let's start over!

replies.commentBody: Actually she didn't remove herself from the investigation, she removed herself from the decision that was to be made as a result of the investigation, and said she would accept the decision of the FBI director.   I'm not sure that's important or not but...

comments.commentBody: Loretta Lynch removed herself from the investigation of HC's e-mails because of a meeting with Bill.  How is Sessions's meetings with the Russian ambassador any diffferent?

replies.commentBody: What's your evidence for these statements? Sources please.

comments.commentBody: President Obama  cannot get over the fact that his legacy may be totally undone by the new administration.  The previous administration holds their so-called honest data  until it appears  that there is something they do not want to come to light about their own administration and  hope they can deflect it by bringing up something about the current administration.  Was it not just two days ago that AG Sessions indicated that there would be a reversal in the policies of local police vs. enforcement of laws on the books re: illegal immigrants in  various municipalities?  Wasn't it just yesterday that it was revealed that the Obama DOJ had drained off some DOJ funds  and redirected them to liberal groups supportive of the Obama policies?   Do they  fear that AG Sessions might start an investigation into that misdeed?     Ms.Warren lied about her ethnicity; Sen. Franken was questionably  elected by a small margin after it was discovered that felons had voted for him; Ms. Pelosi and President Obama misled the American people regarding the ACA and Mr. Holder played his role at DOJ with complete disregard for established rule of law. Are  we we really  supposed to believe that these actions on the part of the Obama administration are not politically motivated?  It may time for the NYT  to replay the video and audio of Mr. Obama's meeting with the Russian diplomat during his run for a second term to remind the American people  of his interaction with the Russians.
